thesis.description: Because total amount of lignin in the stems of cured hay plays such an important role in determining nutritive value and digestibility, this investigation was undertaken to study the process of lignification within red clover stems and relate the findings thereof to digestibility. Plants were cut at 5 different stages of maturity, and the degree of lignification determined for each stage by methods of plant histology. These individual stages were then fed to sheep and feces examined for undigested lignified elements. Lignification is initiated in the xylem, very early in the life of the plant; bundle cap cells and parenchyma tissue adjacent to the vascular strands are characteristically differentiated into elements of varying lignin content with progressive maturity. Fecal excretions on plant residues for each of the 5 cuttings proved that comminution, and henceforth digestibility of plant tissues, is directly influenced by stage of maturity and degree of lignification of the plants.

thesis.description: A formula portending to predict the pressure drop due to flow of gases accompanied by a large temperature change, derived from the differential form of the Bernoulli equation by J. H. Holden and W. Gauvin of McGill University, is presented for verification. Heating runs are made for air flowing through a horizontal steam-jacketed commercial pipe, throughout a Reynolds number range of 6000- 15,000. The observed pressure drops are found to agree very closely with those calculated by means of the given equation. The method of evaluating pressure drop for turbulent non-isothermal runs by assuming that these runs occur isothermally at a temperature mid-way between the surface temperature and the mean bulk temperature of the fluid, first developed by McAdams for certain oils, is also tested for a number of selected runs. This method is found to be as accurate as the previous one, and to have the advantage of being less cumbersome in application.

In Part II, extensive work on the fermentation of carbohydrates by this organism is reported.

thesis.description: The effects of altered thyroid states have been investigated in a DMBA induced mammary tumor system in Sprague-Dawley rats. Results revealed that both tumor incidence and gross tumor yields were less in the thyroidectomized and 1-thyroxine treated groups, as compared to the intact controls. Furthermore, increasing the dose of 1-thyroxine in the thyroxine treated group, resulted in a reversaI of the progressive tumor growth potential with regression and complete extinction of a significant number of the established mammary tumors in this group. Histologically, tumors of the thyroidectomized and control groups were identical, while a characteristic morphologic variant was seen only in the mammary tumors of the 1-thyroxine treated group. Since the effect was not universally seen throughout the sections examined in any single tumor nodule, it is postulated that tumors are composed of heterogeneous cell populations, one of which is endocrine-dependent or sensitive to the effects of 1-thyroxine administration.

[...] Another very important requirement arising from the world-wide range of radio telecommunications is that there shall be international understanding and agreement about it. As a result of these studies international committees have discussed the topic with the idea of drafting specifications for measuring interference which can be used universally. [...] This thesis presents a study of the transient response of the radio-frequency and intermediate-frequency circuits of a National type NC-200 commercial superheterodyne communication receiver to pulse excitation. This study was made for the purpose of assisting in the design of the receiver circuits from the point of view of obtaining linear response to radio noise peaks. The results of the investigation show that linear response can be obtained with this type of receiver. Hence, this receiver, with a satisfactory indicator connected to the detector output circuit, nay be used as a Noise Meter.

thesis.description: Phytohemagglutinin (PRA) has a well established mitogenic and blastogenic action when incubated in vitro with lymphoid cells. The action of this substance was studied in vivo and the histological changes induced by PRA in various organs of the rabbit were compared to those induced by a common antigen (human gamma globulin). It is suggested from the data obtained that PRA does not act as a common antigen. In the PRA treated animals the most striking changes were noted in the spleen. There were marked effects on the white pulp but the most significant histologic features were observed in the red pulp and consisted of intense proliferation of cells of the myeloid-erythroid series. This finding suggests that PRA May have a role in the treatment of diseased states of the bone marrow and lymphoid tissues.

thesis.description: Previous studies have shown that the intestinal mucosa of the dog has a decreased synthesis of ATP following hemorrhagic shock. An investigation was initiated into the metabolism of glucose, a nutritional source of energy, in order to determine the cause of the energy loss. The maximal operation of the electron transport mechanism was found to be limited by the poor availability of both a hydrogen donor and cytochrome c. Mongrel dogs were subjected to hemorrhagic shock. Slices and homogenates of mucosa were incubated in the presence of radioactive glucose (C-1, C-6, or uniformly labelled). The QO2 of the slices and homogenates was found to be depressed after shock. Carbon dioxide production by the control mucosa occurred predominantly via the pentose cycle. There was only a slight increase in the activities of the pentose cycle and tricarboxylic acid cycle after shock. There was an increased lactate production after shock, not all of which could be accounted for in terms of glucose. Thus, although there are significant changes in carbohydrate metabolism, they are not as great as those seen in previous studies on ATP synthesis.

thesis.description: Since the parasympathetic ganglion innervating the rat's urinary bladder can be isolated, the effect of preganglionic (decentralization) and postganglionic (denervation) parasympathectomy on the sensitivity of the bladder to various agonists has been studied. Contractions of the isolated whole bladder were recorded on a smoked drum. Decentralization produced an approximately three-fold increase in sensitivity to acetylcholine. Denervation did not change the sensitivity to acetylcholine. McN-A-343, a muscarinic agent was significantly less effective after decentralization and ineffective after denervation. Neither procedure changed the sensitivity to potassium. Atropine antagonized low but not high doses of acetylcholine. This antagonism was less marked on the decentralized than on the control bladder. The lack of supersensitivity after denervation is consistent with the "dual action" hypothesis for acetylcholine suggested by Koelle (1961). McN-A-343 seems to act indirectly in this preparation. Histamine, 5-hydroxytryptamine and andrenaline had little or no effect on the bladder and could not be used to demonstrate an expected supersensitivity after denervation.

Tallies in 1942 in the Gaspe peninsula showed about 75% by volume of the white spruce dead, and about 45% of the black (8). thesis.description: Pulmonary studies in experimental shock indicate deterioration in both function and structure. The arterial hypoxemia of general anaesthesia is associated with a fall in lung compliance and a right to left shunt-like effect. This can be reversed by periodic hyperinflation. The major part of the present studies is designed to assess whether periodic hyperinflation could favourably alter arterial hypoxemia, intrapulmonary shunting, lung morbidity and mortality, of experimental shock. Results showed no significant arterial hypoxemia or "shunting" in the two forms of experimental shock periodically hyperinflated - (i) hemorrhagic, and (ii) superior mesenteric artery clamping; morbidity and mortality were lower in the hemorrhagic shock hyperinflated than in the hemorrhagic shock not hyperinflated. Sham control groups showed pathological lesions similar to shocked groups. A minor second series of experiments assessed whether the immunologically competent white blood cells of transfused blood in shock caused a graft-versus-host reaction in the lungs. This reaction is thought to occur in prolonged cardio-pulmonary bypass procedures. Present results indicate that the reaction does not occur in either experimental or clinical shock.

thesis.description: The large-scale production of synthetic rubber has shown the necessity of obtaining fundamental knowledge concerning the chemical structure of polymers and copolymers. The mechanical and chemical properties of the final polymer and ease of processing have been found to be dependent on many factors other than the choice of monomers. The molecular weight and molecular weight distribution have been shown to be of prime importance. [...] It is the purpose of this present investigation to test the validity of the copolymerization equation using several pairs of monoolefins and diolefins, and to determine the monomer reactivity ratios for their bulk copolymerizations. Further, an attempt will be made to extend the applicability of the copolymerization equation to the emulsion copolymerization of the same pairs. In this way, it is hoped, that besides obtaining knowledge of the gross composition and fine structure of these copolymers in both systems, that more light may be thrown on the effect of various structural factors present in monoolefins and diolefins, whereby they facilitate or hinder monomer entry into copolymer chains.

The most satisfactory basal diet of several tested in this work consisted of 50% powdered milk and 50% cornstarch, with added vitamins and minerals. In a study of simultaneous deficiencies of copper+iron it was observed that the concentration of iron in the liver rose considerably in copper deficiency, and in iron deficiency the copper level rose. thesis.description: This thesis reports on an Investigation into the Pancreatic Duct of the Cat, which was selected because of its anatomical similarity to the human duct. The experiments directed attention to the ducts ability to resist toxic substances, such as those that may be present in a diseased pancreatico-biliary system. Experiments were conducted on eighty nine healthy cats, which were standardised nutritionally. The experiments showed that these so-called toxic agents, under the conditions reported in this thesis, caused no permanent ill-effect, but that incubated infected bile proved to have potent mucolytic and cytotoxic effect. AIso, it became clear that mechanical factors, such as quantity of infusate, pressure, etc. were able to alter the results and it is possible that this variation may effect already reported experimental findings. Finally, it was concluded that a low grade infection in the biliary tree can in a patho physiological system, initiate pancreatic inflammatory disease.

thesis.description: Plasma levels of three estrogens, namely, estrone, estradiol and estriol in 32 patients with breast cancer and 8 normal subjects were determined fluorometrically by using a method developed by Brown as modified by Roy. The results obtained indicate that there is no significant difference between the mean plasma levels of estrone and estradiol in the two groups. The plasma estriol, however, is considerably higher in the breast cancer patients. This elevated estriol suggests an increased activity in estrogen metabolism. An attempt was made to determine the site of this increased activity in three patients with breast cancer by measuring the estrogen level in the peripheral plasma and in mammary vein plasma obtained during mastectomy. Comparison of the values obtained for each patient suggests that the mammary tumor is not the site of increased metabolic activity. When the mean plasma estrogen levels of breast cancer patients were compared to those found in patients with metastatic cancer (Table X1), no significant difference was found between the two groups. The foregoing work indicates that it is not justifiable to conclude that the metabolic disorder of estrogens noted in patients with breast cancer is peculiar to this specific disease until sufficient knowledge exists regarding estrogen metabolism in other diseases.

thesis.description: Maximal heart rate (HR), cardiac output (Qc), oxygen uptake (Vo2) and minute ventilation (V) were measured in; 1. four hockeyists before and again at the end of a four-month season, 2. eleven other athletes (four swimmers, four skiers and three wrestlers) in the trained state only. Subjects exercised upright on a bicycle ergometer. HR was measured by ECG chest electrodes, Qc by the N20 method, V02 by collection of mixed expired air and V by a dry gas meter. Results were; 1. work capacity increased by 10% or more in the hockeyists, but maximal HR, Qc, V02 and V were not increased, 2. these parameters were remarkably constant among all athlete groups in the trained state, except that skiers had a higher V02 which may be a prerequisite for excellence at this sport rather than a training effect. Findings at submaximal work loads provided an explanation for the increased work capacity following seasonal training. Thus, a decreased HR, Qc and V at any given submaximal work load characterized the trained state. Since work after training causes less stress on cardio-respiratory function than it did before training, a higher maximal work capacity is possible with no increase in maximal cardiorespiratory dimensions.

thesis.description: A review of the literature on the physical and chemical properties of serum lipoproteins is given with a discussion on current knowledge of their biosynthesis and role in fat transport. Lipoprotein metabolism in the rat was studied by use of labelled precursors in the form of palmitate and leucine. Lipid of the very low density lipoprotein turned over at a faster rate than that of the other lipoprotein fractions. The protein moiety was found to be removed from the plasma at a rate comparable to that of lipid. Studies with puromycin treated and hepatectomised rats demonstrated the dependence of lipid release upon continuous protein synthesis at the site of lipoprotein formation in the liver. These results are discussed in relation to the current carrier theory of lipid transport.

thesis.description: As a preliminary to the study of the reactions involved in the bleaching of chemical wood pulps, it seemed desirable to investigate the action of alkaline chlorine on various phenols analogous to those which have been isolated in degradative studies of lignins. For example, catechol and guaiacol have been obtained by zinc dust distillation (1), protocatechuic and veratric acids by alkali fusion (2, 3, 4) and vanillin and syringaldehyde by nitrobenzene oxidation (5, 6) of lignins. Accordingly, pyrogallol and, later, vanillin were chosen as simple analogs of the phenolic substances which are normally bleached. Since hypoiodite is a milder oxidizing and halogenating agent than hypochlorite, it was felt that a preliminary investigation of the action of alkaline iodine on these phenols would be more likely to yield positive results, which might be correlated later with those obtained in parallel experiments using chlorine. Extensive rate studies have revealed that the action of these hypohalites on pyrogallol and vanillin is greatly dependent on the hydroxyl ion concentration of the system and can be divided in all cases into two phases, an initial “fast”, followed by a “slow” reaction. A number of products have been isolated from these reactions at various pH levels, and some light was thrown on the nature of the reactions, whether one of oxidation or of halogenation, in the particular cases studied.
